Let's visualize the grid and see if any visual patterns emerge that could help us identify the rule for placing the check marks.import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Create a 20x20 grid initialized with zeros
grid = np.zeros((20, 20))

# Mark the positions of the check marks with ones
for row, col in positions:
    grid[row-1, col-1] = 1  # Adjust for zero-based indexing

# Plot the grid
plt.figure(figsize=(8, 8))
plt.imshow(grid, cmap='gray_r', origin='upper')
plt.title("Grid with Check Marks")
plt.xlabel("Column Index")
plt.ylabel("Row Index")
plt.xticks(range(20))
plt.yticks(range(20))
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()
